title: Villupuram police bust gang from Uttar Pradesh involved in tampering with ATMs

content: A statement from Mysuru Division of South Western Railways said a special team conducted a surprise check onboard Tatanagar-Yesvantpur Express as part of Operation NARCOS

title: Heavy rains lash Mumbai, IMD issues yellow alert; orange for neighbouring districts
content: The Weather Department sounded a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai, forecasting heavy showers at isolated places, and an 'orange' alert for neighbouring Thane, Raigad and Palghar districts

title: Man facing multiple criminal cases killed in encounter with cops in Maharashtra
content: The Pune Police received a tip-off a few days ago back that Shahrukh alias was hiding with his relatives in Lamboti village near Solapur, the official said.

content: The complaint was registered under the category of Lost Property and followed up when the coach was detached at Mysuru after the journey for its primary maintenance schedule

title: Indian Rat Snake vying for official reptile of Kerala status
content: The State Board for Wildlife, which will meet next week, will consider a proposal for notifying the snake, also known as Manja Chera and Karinchera as the official reptile

content: Over 1,300 athletes from across India competed in six events in the inaugural edition of Khelo India Beach Games organised in May on Ghoghla Beach near Diu town

title: Moderate to heavy rains continue in Karnataka’s coastal belt; landslip at Kettikal on outskirts of Mangaluru
content: Trains between Mangaluru and Surathkal are running slowly owing to the second landslip between Padil and Jokatte sections

content: The local police, officers of NHAI and Fire and Emergency services work to restore movement of vehicles

content: Dr. Rajnish Patel, professor of surgery at the government-run B.J. Medical College and Civil Hospital, said DNA matching is still underway for several victims, including former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, who was among those killed in the crash.

title: Police fire on rape accused who attacked officers in Karnataka’s Dandeli
content: Firoz is a rowdy-sheeter who had escaped after raping and robbing a Dalit woman in a forest near Dandeli on June 12, 2025

title: ISRO conducts first successful rocket launching test with payload in U.P.
content: The test conducted on Saturday in collaboration with Thrust Tech India Limited saw the rocket ascend 1.1 km at 5:14:33 p.m., a complete success

title: PM has energy for foreign trips, can he not summon 'empathy' for visiting Manipur: Congress
content: The Opposition party also said this is Mr. Modi's 35th trip abroad since May 2023, and it was "pathetic of the PM to treat Manipur in this awful manner".

title: Book resurrects Assam scientist for millennials
content: ‘Portrait of a Genius’ chronicles the life and contributions of Hiranya Chandra Bhuyan, who died four years before his British mentor won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1977

title: 3-nation tour chance to thank partner countries for support in fight against cross-border terrorism: PM Modi
content: In his departure statement ahead of his three-nation tour, PM Modi said he looks forward to engaging with leaders from partner countries during the summit at Kananaskis, which he is attending at the invitation of Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: ‘Zero corruption’ is the ultimate goal, says Naidu
content: People are by and large satisfied with the implementation of various schemes, but there is no room for complacency, he asserts, and directs officials to identify areas where there is corruption and initiate action accordingly

title: Helicopter crashes near Kedarnath shrine, all seven on board killed
content: The helicopter was flying from Kedarnath to Guptkashi; seven on board, including a 10-year-old, have been confirmed dead by Badri-Kedar Temple committee chief

title: TTD warns of strict action against erring health personnel
content: The warning comes in the wake of allegations that certain staff members are extorting large sums of money from local hoteliers on the pretext of inspections

title: Govt. working to clear 85 lakh tonnes of legacy garbage in State, says Municipal Administration Minister Narayana
content: Of it, nearly 45 lakh tonnes has been cleared and the remaining will be lifted in the next three months to meet the one year deadline set by the Chief Minister, he says

title: Use Hindi words instead of Urdu, Persian: Rajasthan’s new directive to police
content: Rajasthan Minister Jawahar Singh Bedham stated that many students preparing for competitive exams in Rajasthan do not study Urdu as their third language, which puts them at a disadvantage when they join the police force and encounter Urdu and Persian terminology.

title: Violence returns to WB jute industry, manager assaulted
content: A senior official of Auckland Jute mill in North 24-Parganas was assaulted following which the management of the Jute mill put a suspension of work notice putting at stake the livelihood of around 4,000 workers.

title: Patna girl Manisha Thapa, having high ambition in life dies in the Air India plane crash
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader and ​Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary today visited Manisha’s residence in Patna to meet the family members.

title: What India searched for after the Air India plane crash: A digital reflection of collective anxiety
content: Notably, ‘mayday call‘ searches picked up around Thursday afternoon and within an hour, touched 300% increase in searches. The keyword peaked at 4.30 p.m. on June 12, with an 800% increase in searches

title: Traffic reforms fail to decongest Vyttila
content: Stakeholders, including National Highways Authority of India, Kochi Corpn., and PWD, urged to sit together with police and MVD to chalk out steps such as widening free-left turns to decongest the junction, rather than installing barricades

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, look ahead to Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: Marchand makes history in Panthers' Game 5 win
content: Brad Marchand became the first player to score at least five goals in two separate Stanley Cup Final series with two different teams.

title: Durant prefers Heat, Spurs, Rockets, sources say
content: The Heat, Spurs and Rockets are Phoenix Suns star Kevin Durant's preferred trade destinations, sources told ESPN on Saturday night.

title: Burns up 1 at U.S. Open; Scott, Spaun keep pace
content: Sam Burns is one round away from a U.S. Open title but with no margin for error after Saturday's round of 69 left him with a one-shot lead over Adam Scott and J.J. Spaun.

title: Ohtani back in form, homers twice to end drought
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 24th and 25th homers of the season to halt a 10-game drought Saturday night against the Giants.

title: Clark's 32 help Fever hand Liberty first loss
content: Caitlin Clark scored a season-high 32 points in her return as the Fever handed the Liberty their first loss of the season.

title: Still got it: Usman tops Buckley in 1st win since '21
content: Kamaru Usman got back on the winning track, outwrestling Joaquin Buckley to score a unanimous decision Saturday night.

title: Rockies have worst 70-game mark since 1899
content: After Saturday's loss to Atlanta left Colorado with a 13-57 record, the Rockies have the fourth-fewest wins by any team through their first 70 decisions in a season in MLB history and the fewest since the 1899 Spiders.

title: Poch: Pulisic can't dictate which games he plays
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he wouldn't allow Christian Pulisic to dictate which games he would be available for.

title: 📷 Inside the closets of SGA and Haliburton
content: From clutch performances to fashion icons, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's and Tyrese Haliburton's closets contain the magic.

title: 'It would be incredible': A lot at stake for the four golfers on top of the U.S. Open leaderboard
content: The four golfers leading the U.S. Open heading into the final round might be a surprise. But all four have set themselves up to be a part of history on Sunday.

title: Why Caitlin Clark offers the best betting value for MVP
content: With Caitlin Clark set to return to the court on Saturday, there's no better time to bet on her to win WNBA MVP than right now.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out

content: Formula 1 leader Oscar Piastri stayed hopeful after a qualifying session that had McLaren boss Andrea Stella talking of damage limitation in Sunday's Canadian Grand Prix.

title: Inter Miami, Al Ahly open Club World Club with stalemate -- but FIFA will be happy

title: Mega-preview: Predictions, what you need to know about all 32 teams
content: Saturday sees the start of the tournament, with 32 teams playing 63 games between June 14 and July 13.

title: Messi denied late as Miami draws CWC opener
content: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami were held to a scoreless draw against Egypt's Al Ahly in the opening game of the Club World Cup on Saturday night.

title: Italy to appoint Gattuso as coach, Buffon confirms
content: Italy are set to appoint their former midfielder Gennaro Gattuso as new head coach to replace the recently sacked Luciano Spalletti, Gianluigi Buffon said.

title: Mexico holds off D.R. to begin Gold Cup with win
content: Defending champion Mexico overcame a slow start to defeat the Dominican Republic 3-2 on Saturday night in a Concacaf Gold Cup group stage match.

title: Inter's Taremi stuck in Iran and will miss CWC
content: Inter Milan forward Mehdi Taremi will not be able to join his teammates at the Club World Cup in the United States as he is stuck in Tehran amid the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel.

title: Sources: Spurs agree €40m deal for Bayern's Tel
content: Tottenham Hotspur have reached an agreement with Bayern Munich to sign Mathys Tel on a permanent transfer, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: B'mouth to sign Kerkez replacement
content: Bournemouth have agreed to sign Adrien Truffert, sources have told ESPN, in a move that paves the way for Milos Kerkez to complete a move to Liverpool.

title: Reijnders: I'm not at City to replace De Bruyne
content: Tijjani Reijnders insists he's not aiming to replace Kevin De Bruyne at Manchester City despite revealing the Belgian midfielder is one of his idols.

content: What are NBA insiders saying about the biggest offseason storylines? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst canvass the league.

title: Dodgers desperately need Shohei Ohtani's arm, but his bat will do -- for now
content: The state of L.A.'s injury-riddled pitching staff is alarming. But Ohtani is too valuable to rush back to the mound.

content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

content: We asked NFL evaluators to pick out prospects in next year's draft class who aren't being talked about enough right now. Here are 10 names to know.

title: CM Stalin to inaugurate Katpadi’s first full-fledged government hospital
content: The Chief Minister will visit Ranipet, Vellore and Tirupattur districts on June 25-26, where he will handover government welfare assistance to beneficiaries and review ongoing works.

title: Palaniswami criticises Stalin for not being able to get funds under RTE Act
content: The State government must stop playing immediately with the education of children belonging to the poor and the middle class, he says

title: New jumping spider species discovered in southern India; possibly a first for rare genera, say researchers
content:
The discovery possibly marks the first time that the genera Spartaeus and Sonoita groups of the Spartaeinae
 sub-family have been found in India; the jumping spiders are known for their intelligent hunting skills and web-invasion tactics

title: Minister distributes prizes to students at Chennai Press Club
content: HR and CE Minister P.K. Sekar Babu, along with other chief guests, distributed prizes to journalists’ children for their academic performance at a Chennai Press Club event

title: Anbumani plans to hold district general council meetings as a ‘show of strength’
content: He will participate in the district general council meetings to be held between June 15-19 for the 10 district units of the PMK

content: The police also seized a country-made gun, which the accused used to shoot at the personnel. His accomplice has also been apprehended

title: Residents demand widening of narrow Thazhambur Road
content: Traffic jams, potholes and dust on the single-lane stretch are among the many complaints raised; residents say the road turns slushy during rain

title: Six students from T.N. figure in top 100 ranks in NEET UG 2025
content: 76,181 candidates from the State qualify for counselling. Soorya Narayanan S. of Pushpalata Vidya Mandir CBSE School in Tirunelveli tops the State list and secures an all-India rank of 27

title: Tamil Nadu has highest average outstanding loan amount per account in microfinance sector
content: Among the top 10 states, Tamil Nadu has the highest average loan outstanding per account of  ₹31,131 followed by West Bengal at ₹30,488, as per the data

title: Police officer injured during vehicle check; search on for driver
content: The officer suffered fractures in his feet and was rushed to the hospital. Reports also indicate that he sustained injuries to his hand and may require surgical intervention.

title: Dial-112 call thwarts four major crimes across Telangana in 24 hours
content: The State’s centralised emergency platform, managed from the Telangana Integrated Command and Control Centre (TGICCC) in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, acted as the nerve centre for rapid response.

title: When Tamil Nadu’s prominent political leader, Mohan Kumaramangalam, died in 1973 air crash
content: In a span of a little over two years (March 1971-May 1973) of his presence in the Council of Ministers headed by former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, Mohan Kumaramangalam had emerged as the most conspicuous Union Minister

title: Reading Day to be celebrated in schools, but libraries face neglect
content: Despite govt.’s Reading Day and Reading Week push, libraries in State’s schools remain unutilised – primarily owing to a lack of librarians

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Another body recovered from crash site; medical college confirms four MBBS students among victims
content: Among those killed were four MBBS students from B.J. Medical College, who were having lunch in the mess building when the tragedy struck

content: The BJP media cell circulated the video of Lalu Prasad of his birthday, in which a supporter enters the room carrying the portrait of Ambedkar and places it close to Prasad’s feet

content: Meitei and Kuki-Zo groups mourn the deaths of both K. Nganthoi Sharma and Lamnunthem Singson, two cabin crew hailing from different communities, in the Air India plane crash on June 12

title: Revanth extends all out support to Telugu Film industry, urges collaboration for Telangana’s $3 trillion vision
content: The Chief Minister urged the film industry to prepare a comprehensive plan for its development and submit it to the government, assuring that all necessary support would be provided

content: Congress chief slams comments indicating that “accidents do happen”, in an apparent reference to the Home Minister’s earlier remarks

title: Retailers at Mahanti Fish Market oppose relocation proposal, say it will cost their livelihood
content: According to sources in the VMC, the shifting is being done to address traffic issues caused by the loading and unloading of vehicles at the market, which has reportedly become a cause of inconvenience for the public, among other reasons

title: Reset with Canada, Trump tariffs, Iran-Israel tensions to dominate as Modi leaves for 3-nation tour
content: In first visit abroad since Operation Sindoor, Modi to visit Cyprus, Canada, Croatia, attend G-7 outreach summit; Modi to meet with Canadian PM Mark Carney, which is being referred to as a chance to restore diplomats in each other’s capitals

title: Fear of flotsam
content: After plastic waste from the Liberian vessel that sank off the coast of Kochi floated up to the western Kanniyakumari coast, fishermen were upset at the damage it could cause to their livelihood. C. Palanivel Rajan and Shankari Nivethitha B. speak to experts and members of the fishing community to understand where the fears come from. Both groups have called on the State government to undertake a study on the long-term environmental impact of this incident

title: Crash narrowly missed residential area and three hospitals, staving off a larger death toll
content: While right behind the crash site is Meghani Nagar, to its immediate right is the Military Hospital inside the Cantonment. There are two other hospitals in the vicinity i.e. the Civil Hospital, and, a little further, is the Gujarat Cancer Society Medical College

title: Not Abhishek’s only Mamata’s photos on Trinamool Martyrs’ Day rally
content: Abhishek Banerjee opts out, citing absence from 1993 movement; leadership seeks to contain infighting in Birbhum ahead of rally

title: Honeymoon hit job in serene Sohra
content: A murder — allegedly plotted in Madhya Pradesh and executed 2,250 km away in Meghalaya — has left the people of Sohra, one of the world’s wettest places, shaken as much as the family members of the victim, Raja Raghuvanshi, in Indore. While the hill town in the northeastern State wants those who defamed its residents for a crime they did not commit to apologise, the central Indian city on the Malwa plateau seeks justice for one of its sons, report Rahul Karmakar and Mehul Malpani

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Last remains of crash victims begin to reach families
content: One more body retrieved from under the tail of the aircraft; two days on, no official data on deaths among medical college residents

title: Facelift for Chamundi Hills inches closer to reality under PRASHAD scheme
content: The scheme looks to meet the needs of devotees as well as tourists, and build amenities that would encourage both the groups to visit the site more often

title: Preventive detention must not act as a substitute for criminal prosecution or bail: SC judgment
content: Top court rules on plea against a Kerala HC order that upheld a lower court’s order to detain a man under the Kerala Anti-Social Activities (Prevention) Act, 2007

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Air India to provide ₹25 lakh interim payment to kin of deceased, survivors
content: This interim payment is in addition to the ₹1 crore compensation already announced by the parent company, Tata Sons, Air India said in a statement.

title: After 16 years, Tumakuru–Rayadurga rail project picks up pace; over 96% of land acquired
content: The 206-km rail line, connecting Tumakuru in Karnataka to Rayadurga in Andhra Pradesh, passes through five major sections

title: 70% elder abuse complaints in last 3 years in Karnataka were against family members: helpline data
content: The data shows that sons rank consistently as primary perpetrators, followed by daughters-in-law and other close relatives

title: Congress attacks government over abstaining from UNGA resolution on Gaza
content: Have we abandoned India’s consistent stand advocating for a ceasefire, peace, and dialogue, asks Mr. Kharge

title: NEET-2025: Vijayapura boy tops Karnataka
content: Compared to the previous year, the number of candidates qualified from Karnataka this year has declined

title: Baby calls for detoxification of society from fascist ideals propagated by RSS
content: What is needed parallel to a political fight is a cultural fight by democratic and secular forces to detoxify people’s minds of fascist ideals, says CPI(M) general secretary

title: Congress MP sends ‘reminder’ to Rajya Sabha chair on pending impeachment motion against Justice Shekhar Yadav
content: Allahabad High Court judge accused of making communal remarks; impeachment motion signed by 55 Opposition MPs in December 2024; MP also seeks Parliamentary inquiry against Justice Yashwant Varma

title: Karthik Ram Kireeti is Andhra Pradesh State topper in NEET-2025
content: He has secured 19th rank at the All-India level in the General category; five other students from the State have secured all-India level ranks below 100

title: Air India crash: Gut feeling, gridlock & a mom’s plea – How fate stopped 7 from taking AI 171
content: Seven passengers narrowly avoided tragedy on Air India Flight 171 due to a series of unforeseen circumstances. A mother's heartfelt plea, paperwork issues, a sudden change of heart, traffic delays, and a delayed business trip all conspired to keep them off the ill-fated flight. While some were frustrated at the time, they later realized these obstacles were life-saving interventions.

title: Israel's Op Rising Lion: Satellite images reveal damage at Iran's nuclear site
content: Satellite images reveal damage to Iranian missile bases in Kermanshah and Tabriz following Israeli strikes. The Natanz nuclear facility also sustained damage, impacting structures supplying power, though underground enrichment halls appear untouched. These attacks, part of Operation Rising Lion, follow escalating tensions and retaliatory strikes between Israel and Iran.

title: AI crash: DNA samples match remains of ex-Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani
content: In a tragic turn of events, DNA analysis has confirmed that the remains recovered from the Air India Flight AI171 crash site belong to former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani. The ill-fated London-bound flight, carrying 242 passengers, crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad airport.

title: ‘Give whole body, not partial remains’: Kin of Ahmedabad plane crash victims
content: The victim identification process in Ahmedabad faces difficulties as officials grapple with the grim task of identifying charred remains. A particularly challenging case involved finding two heads in a single body bag, necessitating a repeat of the DNA testing. Authorities are struggling to console grieving families, who are desperately seeking the complete remains of their loved ones for final rites

title: RBI to tighten rules for overseas remittances by Indians- check what's planned
content: The Reserve Bank of India plans to tighten regulations on international money transfers by Indian residents, targeting foreign currency deposits with lock-in periods. These modifications aim to prevent the Liberalised Remittance Scheme from being used for passive wealth shifting, a concern for the RBI.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: Facing US restrictions on advanced AI chips, Chinese firms are innovating by processing data abroad. Engineers transported data to Malaysia, utilizing Nvidia chips in local data centers to train AI models. Southeast Asia is becoming a hub for these activities, testing the limits of regulatory oversight as data centers rapidly expand.

title: Happy father's day: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Father's Day, celebrated globally on the third Sunday of June, honors fathers and father figures for their guidance and love. Originating in the US in the early 20th century, Sonora Smart Dodd championed the holiday, officially recognized in 1972. Celebrations vary across cultures, emphasizing family time and appreciation.

title: Israel's 'Op Rising Lion': Trump denies US role; Iran claims 'solid proof' of American support
content: Iran claims to possess evidence implicating US forces in supporting recent Israeli airstrikes, particularly targeting the Natanz nuclear site. US President Trump denied any American involvement, warning Iran against retaliation while suggesting a potential deal between Iran and Israel. The US Secretary of State also stated that US has no role to play in Israeli attacks on Iran.

title: World's second richest man: Jeff Bezos loses world’s No 2 spot; who's taken his place
content: Larry Ellison surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, driven by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth reached $243 billion, exceeding Bezos' $227 billion and Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.

title: Noida’s ‘Jungle Trail’ to open in July; visitors can enjoy night safari
content: Noida's Jungle Trail, a 20-acre waste-to-wonder park featuring 700 life-sized animal sculptures made from scrap materials, is set for a trial run on June 25 and an official opening in early July. Developed in collaboration with Z-Tech, the park aims to offer an immersive wildlife experience with a night Jungle Safari.

title: Meet the designer embedding ‘India’s fingerprint in space’ with badge for Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Group Captain Subhanshu Shukla will carry a mission badge designed by Manish Tripathi on the Axiom-4 mission, symbolizing India's space ambitions and cultural heritage. The emblem, a fusion of tradition and technology, features elements like the Gaganyaan icon, Aryabhata satellite, Jantar Mantar observatory, and India's map, representing the nation's journey in space exploration.

title: Kedarnath tragedy: Helicopter services halted for 2 days— What led to crash?
content: Following a tragic helicopter crash near Kedarnath shrine that claimed seven lives, Uttarakhand's chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has mandated stringent safety protocols for helicopter services. Preliminary investigations suggest adverse weather and poor visibility contributed to the accident. Dhami has ordered a technical expert committee to formulate a strict Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), ensuring thorough inspections and real-time weather assessments.

title: Startup reality: GitHub CEO warns founders; AI can’t replace developers
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke cautioned startup founders that while AI coding assistants facilitate initial launches, scaling requires human developers and technical expertise. He highlighted that AI-built startups often lack the complex systems needed to attract significant investment. Dohmke stressed the importance of coding skills and knowing when to leverage AI versus relying on personal abilities for efficient development.

title: Creta, Fortuner, Brezza: This family gang stole 25 SUVs in Delhi in past 1 year
content: A family in Delhi ran a car theft ring. The gang stole SUVs from posh areas. Raman, his son Sagar, and son-in-law Neeraj are arrested. They stole and sold 20-25 SUVs in 10 months. The gang targeted Hyundai Creta, Fortuner, and Maruti Brezza cars. They used tools to bypass security. Police reviewed CCTV footage and caught them near Uttam Nagar.

title: ICC World Test Championship 2025-27 full schedule: Who will India face in the new WTC cycle?
content: The ICC has unveiled the schedule for the 2025-27 World Test Championship, featuring 71 matches among nine teams. Sri Lanka and Bangladesh will kick off the cycle on June 17, while Australia is set to play the most Tests with 22 games.

title: China rare earths curbs hit Indian industry hard; cos seeking licenses doubles
content: Indian industries face supply chain disruptions as China tightens export controls on rare earth magnets, a crucial component for automobile manufacturing. The number of Indian firms seeking import permits has nearly doubled, including major players like Bosch and TVS Motor.

title: What was found in Minnesota killer's car? AK-style rifle, ‘No Kings’ flyers & more
content: A manhunt is underway in Minnesota for Vance Boelter, suspected of fatally shooting a former House Speaker and her husband, and wounding a state Senator and his wife. The suspect, who impersonated a police officer, had "No Kings" flyers, linked to anti-Trump protests, in his vehicle.

title: BCCI announces 2025-26 domestic cricket season: Full schedule, groups, dates and key changes
content: The BCCI has unveiled the domestic cricket schedule for 2025-26, starting with the Duleep Trophy on August 28. Zonal selections return for key tournaments, and a Plate Group is introduced for lower-ranked teams to boost competitiveness. Promotion and relegation rules are adjusted, while the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy will feature a Super League stage.

title: 'If attacked US forces will ... ': Trump's warning to Iran; claims he can 'easily' get deal done
content: Amidst escalating tensions in the Middle East following Israel's Operation Rising Lion, Donald Trump issued a stark warning to Iran. He stated that any attack on the US would be met with unprecedented military force. Trump also distanced the US from the Israeli airstrikes, which targeted Iran's nuclear infrastructure and resulted in the deaths of key Iranian figures.

title: 'Thrust not achieved... falling... Mayday': Last words of Air India pilot before crash
content: Air India Flight 171 crashed into a hostel in Ahmedabad after a failed take-off. The pilot's distress call indicated a lack of thrust moments before the crash. Investigators are analyzing the black box to determine the cause of the thrust failure, as initial assessments found no prior warnings or anomalies during the take-off roll.

title: MG ZS EV now more affordable, up to Rs 4L cut; prices drop across all models
content: JSW MG Motor India has announced significant price cuts across its ZS EV range as part of its sixth-anniversary celebrations in India. The top-spec Essence trim sees the biggest reduction, now priced Rs 4.44 lakh lower. These revised prices are available for a limited time, following a 40% sales growth in May 2025, driven by the Windsor EV.

title: Rajasthan factory worker, son of utensil cleaner, cracks NEET
content: Shrawan Kumar, a 19-year-old from a humble background in Balotra, has cleared NEET, securing a remarkable rank despite working in a factory and his parents washing dishes for a living. Access to electricity and a smartphone significantly aided his studies, enabling him to receive free NEET coaching from government doctors.

title: ‘Half his blood stuck in machine’: UP kidney patient dies during dialysis
content: During an official inspection at Bijnor district hospital, a kidney patient died mid-dialysis due to a power cut and a non-functional generator lacking fuel. The private firm responsible for the dialysis unit is under scrutiny for negligence, with authorities seizing records and initiating legal action due to mismanagement and lack of cleanliness.

title: British jet makes emergency landing in Kerala due to low fuel
content: A British F-35 fighter jet executed an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in Kerala on Saturday night. The aircraft, operating from an aircraft carrier, requested permission to land around 9:30 pm due to critically low fuel levels. Airport authorities swiftly declared an emergency, ensuring a safe landing.

title: 'Non-functioning AC and feeling strange': AI crash victim’s last words to husband
content: Yasmin Vora, along with her nephew Pervez and his young daughter Zuveriya, tragically perished in a plane crash en route to London for a family baby shower. Yasmin had changed her flight to accompany them, and Yasin, her husband, last spoke to her just before takeoff when she expressed concerns about the flight.

title: Dhruv Jurel: MS Dhoni’s admirer, Hanuman bhakt, son of a Kargil War hero
content: Dhruv Jurel's journey from a soldier's son to an Indian cricketer is inspiring. His father, a Kargil War veteran, initially opposed his cricket dream due to financial constraints, but his mother's sacrifice changed everything.

title: 'I take celebrations VERY seriously!' — Temba Bavuma's Ward Councillor
content: Temba Bavuma captained South Africa to a historic World Test Championship victory, their first ICC title in 27 years, defeating Australia by five wickets. Despite a hamstring injury, Bavuma's resilient 66 supported Aiden Markram's century, securing the win. Langa Ward 51 Councillor Lwazi Phakade announced plans for a grand homecoming celebration, honoring Bavuma's inspiring journey from Langa to international success.

title: Uttarakhand: 7 killed after chopper returning from Kedarnath dham crashes; NDRF, SDRF at the spot
content: A helicopter crash in Uttarakhand's Kedarghati region claimed the lives of seven people on Sunday. The Aryan Aviation Pvt Ltd chopper, en route from Kedarnath to Guptkashi, crashed shortly after takeoff around 5:30 am. Authorities have dispatched rescue teams to the remote location.

title: NEET result: Over 12 lakh candidates qualify, check category wise number of students
content: National Testing Agency announced NEET UG 2025 results. Over 22 lakh students appeared. 12.3 lakh candidates qualified this year. Aspirants can check scorecards on neet.nta.nic.in. Category-wise and gender-wise details are available. Female candidates dominated the results. Qualified candidates are now eligible for Medical Counselling Committee counselling. Cut-off marks decreased slightly. Counselling schedule will be announced soon on mcc.nic.in.

title: Watch: R Ashwin fumes after comedy of errors leads to three missed run-outs
content: Ravichandran Ashwin experienced a frustrating moment in a recent TNPL match. A misjudged throw by Ashwin led to a comedy of errors, resulting in three missed run-out opportunities on a single delivery. This incident follows an earlier controversy where Ashwin had a heated argument with an umpire, ultimately leading to a fine.

title: Nuclear sites hit, oil depot targeted: Israel-Iran trade heavy blows; key details
content: Following Israel's strike on Iran's nuclear facility, tensions have escalated dramatically. Israel launched a major counteroffensive targeting Tehran's defense and energy infrastructure, prompting retaliatory missile strikes from Iran that resulted in casualties in northern Israel. The conflict has led to the cancellation of nuclear negotiations and raised global concerns about a wider regional war, with calls for de-escalation.

title: Ahmedabad: Teen whose crash video went viral questioned by cops
content: Aryan Asari, a 17-year-old from Aravalli, was questioned by Ahmedabad police regarding a viral video of the Air India flight 171 crash. The video, showing the plane's descent and explosion, quickly spread online. Aryan, residing near the runway, stated he didn't film it but screen-recorded it from a friend before sharing it with his father.

title: 'Our enemy is your enemy': Netanyahu praises Trump on his birthday; posts a video message
content: Amidst escalating tensions and Israel's military offensive against Iran, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu extended warm birthday wishes to President Donald Trump, lauding him as a steadfast ally. Trump voiced strong support for Israel's actions, deeming the strikes "excellent" and hinting at further consequences for Iran. As hostilities deepen, both sides brace for a potentially prolonged conflict.

title: AI plane crash: Turkey denies Dreamliner maintenance link; issues clarification
content: Following the Air India plane crash, the Turkish government refuted claims that Turkish Technic maintained the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner involved. Agreements between Air India and Turkish Technic, set for 2024-25, only cover maintenance for B777 aircraft, not the 787-8. Air India plans to reduce reliance on Turkish Technic amid strained relations.

title: PM Modi on foreign tour: Cyprus, Canada, Croatia on itinerary- his agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has embarked on a three-nation tour, starting with Cyprus, to strengthen bilateral relations and explore cooperation in trade, investment, and technology. He will then attend the G7 Summit in Canada, addressing global issues and the priorities of the Global South.

title: 'Love-Hate relationship with Lord’s': Steve Smith reflects after WTC final loss
content: Australian batter Steve Smith sustained a finger injury during the World Test Championship Final, dislocating his right little finger while attempting a catch. Fortunately, surgery was avoided, and Smith remains hopeful of participating in the upcoming three-match Test series against the West Indies, commencing June 25.

title: A beautiful celebration: Temba Bavuma’s walk with his son goes viral- watch
content: Temba Bavuma led South Africa to a historic World Test Championship victory at Lord's, ending a 27-year title drought. Following a tense win against Australia, marked by Aiden Markram's century and Bavuma's resilience, the captain shared the momentous occasion with his son.

title: Massive military parade in DC, 'No Kings' protests sweep US - how day unfolded
content: Across the United States, widespread anti-Trump protests unfolded coinciding with President Trump's military parade in Washington, D.C., marking the Army's 250th anniversary. Demonstrations, organized under the banner "No Kings," criticized the administration's policies. Tensions flared in cities like Los Angeles and Phoenix, leading to clashes and arrests.

title: Aiden Markram shares the story of having a drink with fan at Lord's
content: Aiden Markram's remarkable 136 led South Africa to a historic five-wicket victory over Australia in the World Test Championship at Lord's, securing their first major ICC trophy since 1998. Markram's match-winning innings and resilience helped the team overcome past failures, especially after the T20 World Cup final defeat.

title: NASA launching rockets to probe ionospheric clouds disrupting global communication
content: NASA is embarking on the Sporadic-E ElectroDynamics (SEED) mission, launching rockets from Kwajalein Atoll to investigate unpredictable Sporadic-E layers in the ionosphere. These layers disrupt radio signals, impacting communication and navigation systems. The mission aims to understand their formation and behavior near the magnetic equator, enhancing prediction models to mitigate signal interruptions.

title: Iran launches fresh missile barrage; Israel hits back; 14 injured in Tehran strikes
content: Iran launched a fresh wave of missile attacks against Israel, hitting residential areas and prompting retaliatory airstrikes on Tehran. Explosions and sirens echoed across Israel, with reports of injuries and damage to buildings. In response to the Israeli strikes, Iran activated its air defenses, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Gunmen kill at least 100 in north-central Nigeria village attack, says Amnesty
content: Dozens missing, homes torched, and hundreds wounded in overnight massacre in Benue state; rights group and police confirm attack

title: India abandons SCO statement condemning Israel
content: India has distanced itself from an SCO statement condemning Israel's strikes on Iran, reflecting its continued support for Israel. This follows India's abstention from a UN vote seeking a Gaza ceasefire. While India values its ties with Iran and the SCO for trade and counterterrorism, its strong relationship with Israel, particularly in defense, appears to be a deciding factor.

title: Vijay Rupani's Body Identified At Ahmedabad Crash Site, DNA Matching Done
content: The identity of former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani has been confirmed through DNA testing, three days after the catastrophic crash of Air India flight AI171 in Ahmedabad. The test results came in at 11:10 am on Sunday.

title: What Are F-35 Fighter Jets, Why Donald Trump Offered Them To India
content: A British F-35B Lightning II fighter jet, part of the HMS Prince of Wales Carrier Strike Group, made an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in Kerala late Saturday evening.

title: Israel Bombed World's Largest Gas Field In Iran. Why It Is A Big Deal
content: Iran was forced to partially halt gas production at the world's largest gas field, South Pars, after an Israeli airstrike caused a fire at one of its key processing units on Saturday.

title: Maharashtra Family, Ex-Army Pilot Among 7 Victims Of Kedarnath Chopper Crash
content: An Aryan Aviation Helicopter, flying to Guptkashi from the Kedarnath Dham, with seven on board, crashed Sunday morning.

title: Why A British F-35 Fighter Jet Made Emergency Landing In Kerala
content: A British F-35B fighter jet was forced to make an emergency landing in Keralaon Saturday night, after dangerously running low on fuel while flying a mission over the Arabian Sea.

title: British F-35 Fighter Jet Makes Emergency Landing At Kerala Airport
content: A British F-35 fighter jet made an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram airport in Kerala on Saturday.

title: How Russia Could Emerge As Power Broker To End Israel-Iran Conflict
content: Russia has maintained a delicate balancing act in the Middle East for decades, trying to navigate its warm relations with Israel even as it has developed strong economic and military ties with Iran.

title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE: Iran Missiles Kill 10 In Israel Amid Trump's Big Warning To Tehran
content: Israel-Iran Attack Live: Israel and Iran on Sunday exchanged attacks for the third day, with the Israeli military saying it conducted an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and the SPND nuclear project.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live Updates: Ex-Chief Minister Vijay Rupani's DNA Matches, 32 Bodies Identified So Far
content: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live Updates: The bodies of the 274 victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash, who have been identified, are set to be handed over to their families by the Gujarat government on Sunday, sources said.

title: 80 Killed In Iran, Israel Airspace Closed As Middle East Tensions Escalate
content: Israel and Iran exchanged fresh attacks early Sunday, with the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) claiming an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and a nuclear project.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu Postpones Son's Wedding As Iran Rains Missiles On Israel
content: The wedding of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's son has been reportedly postponed amid the escalating conflict with Iran.

title: 1st Responder Was Having Lunch At Hostel Where Air India Plane Crashed
content: An ambulance driver saw the lone survivor of the crashed AI171 aircraft walking from the plane and then attempting to go back to save his relative on board.

title: "Mistakes Must Not Be...": Amit Shah On BJP Leader's Controversial Remarks
content: Union Ministers Amit Shah and Bhupendra Yadav on Saturday cautioned BJP leaders against making controversial statements, saying "restraint in speech is the most important virtue" and that "sometimes, it is wiser to stay silent."

title: Balloons, Bubbles, Tear Gas: How LA Anti-Trump Protests Turned Chaotic
content: For hours, thousands of people in Los Angeles peacefully celebrated their defiance of US President Donald Trump Saturday with music, marching, bubbles and balloons -- then police unexpectedly moved in, and chaos and confusion broke out.

title: What's At Stake If Israel-Iran Conflict Escalates? 5 Worst-Case Scenarios
content: Israel on June 13 launched a sweeping aerial offensive, striking over 100 strategic targets, from nuclear facilities to military installations, across Iran.

title: 100-Feet Tall Mobile Tower Collapses In Delhi
content: A 100-feet tall mobile tower collapsed in south Delhi's Safdarjung Enclave early Sunday due to strong winds and rain, police said.

title: "If We Are Attacked In Any Way By Iran...": Donald Trump's Big Warning
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said that the US had "nothing to do" with the overnight attack on Iran, hours after Israel claimed an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and a nuclear project.

title: Chilling Video Shows Massive Fire At 67-Storey Dubai Skyscraper
content: Authorities confirmed that all 3,820 residents from 764 apartments were safely evacuated, with no reported injuries.

title: Pool, Bathtub Found Inside Religious Site During Demolition Drive In Gujarat
content: A swimming pool, a bathtub and huge, spacious rooms - these were among the constructions that were found inside an illegally-built religious site in Jamnagar.

title: Turkey Rejects Claims Linking Its Firm To Crashed Air India Dreamliner
content: An Air India flight to London crashed in Ahmedabad on Thursday, killing 241 people on board and several others on the ground.

title: From 800 fans to 24,000: Murray State's Cinderella run to Omaha
content: Murray State takes down Duke in the Durham Super Regional to earn a spot in the men's college world series . the team is constantly on the go, eating a lot of Jimmy John's and Panda Express in the bus . a private jet was whisking them to Omaha for the mid-major program's first trip .

title: Storylines, top players and predictions
content: college baseball analyst Riggins joins "the Paul Finebaum Show" to discuss the top two remaining seeds going head-to-head in their MCWS opener . this year's tournament brings a mix of competition, featuring teams from six conferences and one independent .

title: Mya Lesnar, daughter to WWE legend Brock Lesnar, wins national title in shot put
content: Mya Lesnar secured a national championship in the women's shot put finals at the NCAA Outdoor Track and Field Championships on friday . on first attempt, mya recorded a mark of 19.01 meters (62 feet, 4 12 inches) and would stay in the lead the entire competition . the mark finished as much as five inches and a quarter ahead of the next best competitor .

title: Sun Belt Conference preview: James Madison looks to close deal this time
content: Coastal Carolina has two in the past five . Georgia Southern is coming off its best season in four years . nearly everyone in the Sun Belt has reached solid to great heights of late . if you have to lose every game, that's an awfully impressive sign of parity and general conference health .

title: Vegas got what grade now?! Checking in on all 13 teams
content: ESPN grades all 13 teams and tackles some of the biggest questions facing the WNBA . the Liberty has dominated, outscoring opponents by 171 points, the most by any team through nina . it's tough to take issue with the Liberty's 9-0 record and their mindset moving forward .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Rutgers part of Big Ten surge
content: the Big Ten is flexing its muscles on the recruiting trail with 10 teams ranked among the top 25 classes . americans still sit at no. 1 while Ohio State pushes to no. 2 after a pair of ESPN 300 additions: in-state RB Favour Akih and DE Khary Wilder .
